intro: Koanophyllon albicaule, commonly known as the white-stemmed blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations such as succulent leaves and reduced foliage to conserve water. Its flowers are small and blue to purple in color, often arranged in dense clusters. Koanophyllon albicaule is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in poor soils, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
